past.name: Boudica
past.caption: Boudica was a queen of the British Iceni tribe who led an uprising against the conquering forces of the Roman Empire in AD 60 or 61.

past.name: Roman Empire
past.caption: The Roman Empire was the post-Republican period of ancient Rome.

past.name: Hadrian's Wall
past.caption: Hadrian's Wall is a former defensive fortification of the Roman province of Britannia, begun in AD 122 in the reign of the emperor Hadrian.

present.name: Great Wall of China
present.caption: Caption about Great Wall of China

past.name: Julius Caesar
past.caption: Gaius Julius Caesar was a Roman general and statesman, who led the Roman armies in the Gallic Wars before becoming dictator of Rome from 49 BC until his assassination in 44 BC.

past.name: Fall of the Roman Empire
past.caption: The fall of the Roman Empirewas the loss of central political control in the Western Roman Empire, a process in which the Empire failed to enforce its rule, and its vast territory was divided into several successor polities.

present.name: End of the Third Reich
present.caption: Caption about End of the Third Reich

present.name: End of the British Empire
present.caption: Caption about End of the British Empire
